thread.title: 10 Thalis You Absolutely Must Try In Mumbai
thread.title_full: 10 Thalis You Absolutely Must Try In Mumbai

author: Ishita Bhojwani
title: 10 Thalis You Absolutely Must Try In Mumbai

persons.name: udipi shree krishna boarding © a.rama nayak
shree thaker bhojanalay © shree thaker bhojanalay

text:
Food & Drinks By Ishita Bhojwani , Friday, 10 Feb 2017 
There’s something about eating a plate laden with the most scrumptious food; the thali. Be it something spicy, or sweet or sour; right from Gujarati cuisine to seafood, the Mumbai Thalis offer you a variety of options you simply can’t say no to. Here’s where you should go in Mumbai to get the best of the thali. 1. Premium Veg Thali at Maharaja Bhog © Maharaja Bhog 
The best vegetarian Thali to experience, which is a mix of Gujarati and Rajasthani food. The food is served piping hot, and their hospitality is what makes it different. The service is always perfect and they make sure your plate never goes empty. 
Address: Across outlets in Juhu, Malad, Goregaon, Powai 2. Veg Thali at Shree Thaker Bhojanalay © Shree Thaker Bhojanalay 
This is for the ones who love a wholesome meal, with a good ambience. This place, undoubtedly, serves the best Khichdi. You just can’t say no to the waiters for a second or third or even a fourth serving! 
Address: 31, Dadisheth Agyari Lane, Off Kalbadevi Road, Kalbadevi 3. Deluxe Thali at Bhagat Tarachand © Bhagat Tarachand 
Treat your tastebuds with a little modernized Gujarati food, at one of the oldest restaurants in the country that’s been there since 1978. All of their food is cooked in ghee, and you need to devour it when steaming hot. 
Address: Across outlets in Malad, Thane, Vashi, CST, Marine Lines 4. Andhra Thali at Gonguura © Gonguura 
One of the hidden gems in the city serving some mean pure vegetarian food in and around Andhra. Their thali is a traditional wholesome meal in itself. 
Address: 6, Juhu Ekta Co-operative Housing Society, Juhu Versova Link Road, Juhu 5. Traditional South Indian Thali on Banana Leaf at A.Rama Nayak’s Udipi Shree Krishna Boarding © A.Rama Nayak's Udipi Shree Krishna Boarding 
Serving authentic South-Indian meals since 1942, this one is your go-to place if you enjoy having a hands-on meal without spoons. Eat all you can, on a banana leaf. It is always buzzing with people, so we’d suggest reaching early. 
Address: 1st Floor, LBS Market Building, Near Matunga Central Railway Station, Matunga East 6. Special Gujarati Thali at Thackers © Thackers 
If you fancy an ambience overlooking the sea i.e. at Marine Drive, this one should be on your list. They have retained their authenticity over the years, in terms of taste. 
Address: 1st Floor, Birla Kreeda Kendra, Chowpatty 7. Pancham Thali at Pancham Puriwala © Pancham Puriwala 
As the name suggests, these guys make different types of puris! Almost 150 years old, this small food corner is always buzzing with people. So, if you want to try some delicious greasy food, this one should be your pick. 
Address: 8-10, Perin Nariman Street, Fort 8. Surmai Fish Thali at Jai Hind Lunch Home © Jai Hind Lunch Home 
They serve their legendary seafood, in a thali. So, if you are a seafood lover, this one’s a must-try. 
Address: Across outlets Lower Parel, Dadar, Bandra
